title: Energy in circuit - U-ef in wires and resistor

content.question: When a battery and a resistor are connected together by conducting wires in a single-loop circuit, an electric field is generated within the circuit. Which of the following statements is true about the electric potential energy <math alttext="U sub electric field" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>e-f</mtext></msub></math> for the system composed of the circuitâ€™s electric field and a single electron moving through the circuit?

choices.label: <math alttext="U sub electric field" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>e-f</mtext></msub></math> increases by a nonnegligible amount when the electron moves through one of the conducting wires.

<math alttext="U sub electric field" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>e-f</mtext></msub></math> decreases by a nonnegligible amount when the electron moves through one of the conducting wires.

<math alttext="U sub electric field" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>e-f</mtext></msub></math> increases by a nonnegligible amount when the electron moves through the resistor.

<math alttext="U sub electric field" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>e-f</mtext></msub></math> decreases by a nonnegligible amount when the electron moves through the resistor.

content.answer: <math alttext="U sub electric field" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>e-f</mtext></msub></math> decreases by a nonnegligible amount when the electron moves through the resistor.
